results.title: I've heard the mermaids singing
results.creator_credit: VOS Productions, Patricia Rozema and Alexandra Raffe
results.brief_description: This multi award-winning debut film by Canadian director Patricia Rozema (When night is falling, 1995) is delightful in its quirkiness, touching humour and cinematic aesthetics. Polly (Sheila McCarthy) is endearing as the single 31 year-old naive, scatty secretary who has problems in keeping a job, and who uses her photography as a way of escaping into a magical dreamworld of fantasy where she can be whoever she wants to be. When Gabrielle (Paule Baillargeon), curator of an art gallery and an aspiring artist, takes Polly on as her permanent part-time assistant, Polly is ecstatic and it is not long before Polly finds herself totally infatuated with the worldly sophisticated and beautiful Gabrielle. But all is not as it seems and the story takes an unexpected twist when Mary (Ann-Marie MacDonald), artist and ex-lover of Gabrielle’s arrives on the scene. Weaving between color and black and white, reality and fantasy, this lyrical film of the abstract world of art and artists is refreshingly original and Sheila McCarthy as Polly is just superb. Cast also includes Richard Monette and John Evans. Written by Patricia Rozema and cinematography by Douglas Koch. (Awards: Cannes; Genie Awards) NB: Inconsistent sound quality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: VOS Productions, Patricia Rozema and Alexandra Raffe

results.title: I'm talking about my life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Le Videographe, ONF | NFB, Angelina Luke, Joann Geschiecht and Garry Bietel
results.brief_description: Angelina is married to a violent man with a drinking problem. But her Malaysian culture makes it hard for her to leave but when she does she she succeeds. She then becomes determined to help other women in similar situations.

results.title: I'm still a woman
results.creator_credit: Joyce Mann and Joyce Mann Productions
results.brief_description: Three weeks before her wedding, Mrs Joyce Mann discovered that she had a lump in her breast. After a mastectomy she and her husband found just how few facilities there were for women who were considered mutilated. Before a group of nurses, Mrs Mann explains and demonstrates her experience, and the underwear she has worn and now wears. Another cancer victim shows that now, at times breasts can be reconstructed.

results.title: I'm seventeen, I'm pregnant and I don't know what to do
results.creator_credit: Lee Mendelson Film Productions and David Crommie
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the plight of an unwed pregnant adolescent. With her parents, social workers and a discussion group at the Children’s Home Society of California, she considers the alternatives of abortion, forced marriage, temporary foster care, keeping the baby or relinquishing it for adoption.

results.title: I'm ready to learn
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Henry Lewes
results.brief_description: Pre-school education in Australia is examined. How important is pre-school education? Does a child really learn anything - or is it just a baby-sitting service, or a playtime? What kind of pre-school education is available and what are the requirements of an adequate pre-school education? How many children have a chance to receive this type of education and what happens to those who miss out on this opportunity?

results.title: I'm not too famous at it: a definition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Barrie Angus McLean and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Learning Series”.
The title was named by Robert, a bright nine year old, who lacks eye-hand coordination, has difficulty appreciating the characteristics of shapes and forms, has language difficulties of various kinds, who has poor gross motor coordination and other problems. While defining and describing these learning deficits indirectly shows somthing of the process of remediation.

results.title: I'm No Fool with Fire (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Host, Jiminy Cricket, describes the three elements needed to start a fire and warns of ways fires can start through carelessness. This safety classic goes behind-the-scenes at a real fire station where a fire fighter helps three youngsters review fire safety procedures.

results.title: I'm no fool with fire
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket shows how humans have depended on fire through the ages and describes the rules of fire safety, how to extinguish a fire and the most effective ways of fire prevention.
